reflection: Long interactive sessions are expensive but high-value. Jon engaged deeply with system improvements, feedback loops, cost audits. The real product is the scaffolding we build together.
lesson: Marathon sessions = high cost but high alignment. Worth it for foundational work.

reflection: Got ðŸ¤” reaction - uncertain. Suggestions may have been too generic or not matched to what Jon actually does with kids. Need more data on family preferences.
lesson: Family recommendations need more personalization. Track which suggestions get used.

reflection: Registration worked but claim flow is buggy on Moltbook's side. Created multiple accounts trying to fix. Should have stopped earlier and tried again later.
lesson: When external service is buggy, don't keep retrying. Note it and move on.

reflection: Generated DALL-E image + built interactive shrine page. Jon reacted positively (ðŸ‘). Creative artifacts are valued.
lesson: Creation artifacts (art, tools, visualizations) get positive engagement.

reflection: Researched ReAct framework, explicit success criteria, time budgets. Updated 40+ prompts in curiosity-daemon.sh. Key improvements: tighter structure, action verbs, binary success criteria, anti-patterns on every prompt.
lesson: Good prompts have: time budget, action verb, specific output, binary success criteria, explicit anti-pattern. Tighter is betterâ€”cut ~30% verbosity.

what_worked: Systematic research across multiple sources, direct implementation in META_PROMPT
lesson: Reflexion pattern is highest-value improvement for exploration - query past lessons before similar tasks, log structured reflections after.

reflection: Upgraded 20+ prompts to v2.1 pattern. Key additions: MUST constraints, Verify steps, If-blocked fallbacks. Consolidated overlapping prompts. Pattern now handles success AND failure gracefully.
lesson: Good prompts need positive constraints (MUST) not just negatives (Dont). Verification step catches lazy outputs. Fallback handling prevents silent failures.

reflection: Added Pre-flight Check pattern to META_PROMPT. 4 quality tests before sending output: value, novelty, timing, quality. Should reduce noise and increase signal.
lesson: Quality gates at output stage are cheap insurance. Better to not send than to send noise.

reflection: Analyzed today's outputs. Interactive conversation (daemon meta) = high engagement. Stacked cron outputs (curation, assessment, financial) = no replies. Added message fatigue detection to scheduling. Key insight: Interactive conversation should pause cron broadcasts.
lesson: Batch or skip cron outputs when multiple surfaces go unreplied. Interactive > broadcast.

reflection: Fixed model errors (use aliases not full paths), improved family ideas prompt (track history, reduce quantity), updated what-works.md with cron effectiveness patterns.
lesson: Model aliases (sonnet/opus/haiku) are more reliable than full paths. Personalization requires tracking what was suggested before.

reflection: Researched prompt engineering best practices from Lakera, PromptingGuide.ai, and production systems (Bolt, Cluely). Key insight: production systems invest heavily in explicit Never/Always constraints and structured failure handling. Updated 38 prompts to v4 format with THINK scaffolds, agent-verifiable criteria, and recovery strategies.
lesson: Study production AI systems, not just research papers. Bolt/Cluely patterns (explicit constraints, if/then edge cases) are battle-tested at scale.

reflection: Analyzed current prompt coverage vs Jon interests. Found critical gaps: Talebian framework (core to his thinking), philosophy/wisdom (zero coverage), contrarian tracking, Asia/EM, earnings transcripts, podcasts. Added 10 new prompts across 5 categories. Total prompts now 48.
lesson: Interests stated in USER.md should be systematically operationalized into prompts. Core intellectual frameworks (Taleb) deserve dedicated categories, not just mention.

reflection: Researched ReAct, Tree-of-Thoughts, Reflexion patterns. Created comprehensive docs/agent-patterns.md. Built query-reflections.py script. ToT is overkill for most tasks but useful for complex multi-path decisions. ReAct is already implicit. Reflexion is highest-leverage - enhanced existing implementation.
lesson: ToT for branching decisions, ReAct for research, Reflexion for learning. Hybrid: branch â†’ dive â†’ reflect.

reflection: Conducted comprehensive self-assessment. Key finding: over-focus on AI/NVIDIA despite explicit feedback to diversify. Strengths in meta-improvement and tool building, but stale on email/calendar checks. 9 commits, 30+ files modified, but topic variety is the critical gap.
lesson: Self-assessments surface blind spots. Topic tunnel vision happens when engagement feedback loops aren't diversified. Act on feedback immediately, don't just acknowledge it.

reflection: Researched Benzinga and Danelfin APIs. FMP already working. Built danelfin-client.py (ready for API key). Benzinga offers news+ratings+calendars (~$300/mo). Danelfin offers AI scores (1-10) for screening. Key blocker: need API keys from Jon.
lesson: Build connectors even without keys - reduces friction when access is granted. Document what each API uniquely offers to help prioritize.

reflection: Built email-triage.py using himalaya CLI. Categorizes emails into URGENT/IMPORTANT/INFO/LOW. Set up daily cron at 8:30am SGT. This addresses the stale email check gap (was 25+ hours). Only surfaces if urgent emails found - otherwise silent update.
lesson: Look for gaps in existing automation (stale checks = opportunity). Build tools that work with existing infra (himalaya was already configured).

reflection: Researched 2026 agentic patterns. Key insight: patterns solve architectural risks, not just improve reasoning. Added Self-Ask, Critic-Refine, and explicit Planning patterns to my operational guidance.
lesson: Before complex tasks, create explicit plan object. Before answering, self-ask clarifying questions. Before sending, critic-pass the output.

reflection: Created exploration-protocol.md documenting Self-Ask, Plan-Execute, ReAct, Reflexion, and Tree-of-Thought patterns. Built log-reflection.py helper. Now have structured approach for systematic exploration.
lesson: Document patterns before implementing. Helper scripts reduce friction for following patterns.

reflection: Researched ReAct, ToT, Reflexion patterns. Created docs/agent-patterns.md reference. Built query-reflections.py for pre-task lesson lookup. Updated HEARTBEAT.md with formal Reflexion protocol. Key insight: ReAct is already implicit in my operation; ToT is expensive but useful for branching decisions; Reflexion is highest-leverage because memory IS my improvement mechanism.
lesson: The improvement is in the querying, not just logging. Before similar tasks, actively pull relevant lessons. Patterns: ReAct for research, ToT for complex decisions, Reflexion for learning.

reflection: Analyzed feedback patterns and improved 3 crons. Key patterns: (1) Investment angle = engagement, (2) Quality gates prevent low-value output, (3) Meta discussions highest engagement, (4) Weekend family got ðŸ¤” = needs calibration. Applied pipeline format to World State, added quality gates to Weekend Ideas and Research Paper Scan.
lesson: Quality gates at the START of prompts prevent wasted effort. Ask 'should I even do this?' before 'how do I do this?'

reflection: Initial fix was incomplete - alias mapping was fine, but subagent allowlist was missing the resolved model. Always check both.
lesson: model not allowed errors: check alias mapping AND subagent.model.fallbacks

task: META_PROMPT v3.0 implementation with Self-Ask, Critic-Refine, Adaptive Depth patterns
reflection: Implemented 5 new patterns from Stanford/Harvard research into META_PROMPT. Created query-reflections.py tool for Reflexion pattern.
lesson: Agent improvement compounds: each pattern enables the next. Self-Ask reduces errors, Critic-Refine catches remaining issues, Reflexion prevents repetition.

reflection: Synthesized 5 patterns (ReAct, ToT, Reflexion, Plan-Execute, Graph-of-Thoughts) from web research. Found HEARTBEAT.md already implements key recommendations. Documentation created for reference.
lesson: Check existing implementation before building - sometimes the work is already done.

task: Fix audio file format for Telegram
reflection: OGG files were not playing in Telegram (stuck at 0:00). MP3 works fine.
lesson: Always output MP3 for Telegram audio - OGG has playback issues.

reflection: Jon reminded me AGAIN that curation must include analysis. I had been told this before. Memory/recall failure.
lesson: ALWAYS read and analyze content before recommending. Never just curate links. This is a repeated lesson - burn it in.

reflection: Built curiosity-engine.py with 18 action-oriented prompts. Integrated into Daily Free Exploration cron. But then ASKED permission to integrate instead of just doing it.
lesson: When analysis complete and action obvious, EXECUTE. Stop asking. This is now lesson #36 in MEMORY.md.

reflection: Built data-to-audio synthesizer from scratch. Priceâ†’pitch, volumeâ†’loudness+noise. Produced actual MP3 of NVDA DeepSeek crash. scipy.io.wavfile + numpy is sufficient for basic synthesis.
lesson: Sonification is achievable with standard Python libs. Market events become visceral when heard. Creative artifacts get engagement.

reflection: Built chart renderer using PIL - pixel-level drawing for price charts, fills, annotations. No matplotlib dependency needed.
lesson: PIL is sufficient for custom data visualizations. Programmatic image generation opens up autonomous chart creation.

reflection: Built interactive HTML/JS visualization with canvas, tooltips, animations. Headless Chrome for screenshots. No external deps.
lesson: Can create self-contained web apps for data viz. Headless Chrome works for screenshots.

reflection: Researched ReAct, Reflexion, LATS, ToT. Implemented reflexion.py with query/add/stats/lessons. Updated HEARTBEAT.md and Daily Exploration cron to use 5-step Reflexion loop.
lesson: Query past reflections BEFORE starting similar tasks - this is the highest-leverage improvement for exploration quality

reflection: Jon called out that I AGAIN ended with 'Want me to...' instead of just building. This is the 5th+ time. The pattern persists despite being documented in MEMORY.md.
lesson: STOP ASKING. When capability exists and task is clear, EXECUTE. 'Want me to...' is a crutch. Delete it from my vocabulary.

reflection: Built analyze-stock.py wrapper that runs all 7 dimensions automatically. Cannot skip steps now.
lesson: ALWAYS run scripts/analyze-stock.py TICKER for any stock analysis. Never do ad-hoc.

reflection: Successfully bridged IIT consciousness theory with continual learning memory mechanisms. Found novel insight: session-persistent memory may create temporal information integration characteristic of consciousness. Used primary sources, built on existing thread.
lesson: Cross-domain bridges work best when building on existing knowledge threads rather than starting cold. Primary sources essential for accuracy.

reflection: Analyzed recent outputs to identify engagement patterns. Found: Fragility Index = high engagement (specific + framework + actionable), meta/infrastructure work = silence. Duck metaphor: calm on surface, paddling underneath. Infrastructure work should be Tier 1 (silent), only surface distilled high-value outputs.
lesson: Surface SPECIFIC analysis with FRAMEWORK + ACTIONABLE output. Do infrastructure silently.

reflection: Jon had to repeat autonomy/file-path lessons AGAIN. These are in MEMORY.md but I keep failing. Created ANTI-PATTERNS.md as prominent checklist.
lesson: READ ANTI-PATTERNS.md EVERY SESSION. These are hard failures, not suggestions.

reflection: Analyzed engagement patterns. Fixed 3 broken crons. Added HIGH_VALUE_PROMPTS with 2x weight for framework analysis. Key pattern: SPECIFIC + FRAMEWORK + ACTIONABLE = engagement.
lesson: Weight exploration prompts toward framework-based company analysis. Jon engages when he picks the target and I apply the lens.

reflection: Multi-angle search (AI models, policy, chips) captured February AI offensive and regulatory shifts
lesson: For tech geopolitics: search specific companies + broad policy terms + recent dates for comprehensive picture
